column4: I have an hp530 notebook, the wireless card is an Intel 3945ABG, and I am pretty sure I have downloaded the correct driver. I am new to this and the readme says something about editing the kernal, but it isn't step-by-step on how to do that. If anyone could help get me started I would very much appreciate it.
using gutsy?
yes
that is the best supported card around today
Well perhaps I'm stupid or something, and it isn't a driver issue.
not at all; getting wireless going can be a challenge at first
you can sudo dhclient if your card sees the AP
this is via the gui? wpa I'm guessing
Yeah in the gui, I am using 64bit hex encryption
this is wep, wpa, wpa2 which one
may as well leave it open then; wep is very insecure--a better bet would be wpa2
i'm not to worried about hackers, just blocking the casual user
can you set the router?
set to what?
can you set the router ie a home router, or is this roaming like at a starbucks etc
yes it is my router
but I would rather leave it encrypted

ok I will try setting it with iwconfig
once you have set it via the cli it should acquire it automatically on boot
command line is cli
in the terminal
